channel.title: NPR Programs: Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump set to deliver State of the Union address amid economic and diplomatic tensions
item.description: President Trump is set to deliver his first State of the Union address of his second term, as he faces a host of key issues from tariffs to Iran.
item.content:encoded: President Trump is set to deliver his first State of the Union address of his second term, as he faces a host of key issues from tariffs to Iran.
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Voters share their thoughts on the state of the union ahead of Trump's address
item.description: Ahead of the State of the Union address, voters describe how they view the economy, immigration and the country's direction.
item.content:encoded: Ahead of the State of the Union address, voters describe how they view the economy, immigration and the country's direction.
item.dc:creator: Hosts

item.title: GOP strategist on what he thinks Trump should focus on in State of the Union address
item.description: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with GOP analyst and speechwriter Mike Ricci about Tuesday night's State of the Union address, and how the norms surrounding the speech have changed.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Leila Fadel speaks with GOP analyst and speechwriter Mike Ricci about Tuesday night's State of the Union address, and how the norms surrounding the speech have changed.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Justice Department withheld and removed some Epstein files related to Trump
item.description: An NPR investigation finds the public database of Epstein files is missing dozens of pages related to sexual abuse accusations against President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
An NPR investigation finds the public database of Epstein files is missing dozens of pages related to sexual abuse accusations against President Trump.

(Image credit: Department of Justice and Getty Images/Collage by Danielle A. Scruggs/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Stephen Fowler

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: Trump to deliver first State of the Union address of his second term, what's next for Mexico after killing of cartel leader, NPR investigation finds DOJ withheld some Epstein files related to Trump.
item.content:encoded: Trump to deliver first State of the Union address of his second term, what's next for Mexico after killing of cartel leader, NPR investigation finds DOJ withheld some Epstein files related to Trump.
item.dc:creator: Steve Inskeep

item.title: 4 years into the war, a Ukrainian pianist processes Russia's invasion
item.description: In a new album, the Ukranian-born, New York-based pianist and composer Vadim Neselovskyi channels the horror and hope he's felt since Russia's incursion.
item.content:encoded:
'/>

In a new album, the Ukranian-born, New York-based pianist and composer Vadim Neselovskyi channels the horror and hope he's felt since Russia's incursion.

(Image credit: Arkady Mitnik)
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Businesses face uncertainty as Trump races to replace tariffs struck down by SCOTUS
item.description: The Trump administration is working quickly to impose new tariffs to replace the import taxes struck down by the Supreme Court. That's creating new uncertainty for businesses and trading partners.
item.content:encoded: The Trump administration is working quickly to impose new tariffs to replace the import taxes struck down by the Supreme Court. That's creating new uncertainty for businesses and trading partners.
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: BAFTAs come under fire after guest with Tourette syndrome uses slur during ceremony
item.description: The BAFTAs were disrupted by an audience member with Tourette syndrome who shouted slurs at Black presenters. TV critic Eric Deggans examines the criticisms of the show's organizer and broadcaster.
item.content:encoded: The BAFTAs were disrupted by an audience member with Tourette syndrome who shouted slurs at Black presenters. TV critic Eric Deggans examines the criticisms of the show's organizer and broadcaster.
item.dc:creator: Leila Fadel

item.title: Winter storm slams Northeast, forcing millions to stay home
item.description: A massive snowstorm pummeled the East Coast Monday, forcing millions of people to stay home amid travel bans and closures.
item.content:encoded: A massive snowstorm pummeled the East Coast Monday, forcing millions of people to stay home amid travel bans and closures.
item.dc:creator: Sarah Ventre

item.title: Country's biggest solar project moving ahead in California
item.description: An enormous solar project is moving forward in California, on land that farmers have had to keep fallow as the state restricts over-pumping the aquifers they previously used to irrigate crops.
item.content:encoded: An enormous solar project is moving forward in California, on land that farmers have had to keep fallow as the state restricts over-pumping the aquifers they previously used to irrigate crops.
item.dc:creator: Dan Charles
